  • Method Details

    • getBuilding

      public Structures.Graph<Division> getBuilding()
      Returns:
      the graph representing the building's divisions

    • setBuilding

      public void setBuilding(Structures.Graph<Division> building)
      Set the graph representing the building's divisions.
      Parameters:
      building - the new graph

    • getNumDivisions

      public int getNumDivisions()
      Gets the number of divisions in the building.
      Returns:
      the number of divisions as an integer

    • addDivision

      public void addDivision(Division division)
      Adds a division to the building.
      Parameters:
      division - the division to add

    • findNearestExit

      public Division findNearestExit(Division currentDivision, Structures.ArrayList<Division> exits) throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Finds the nearest exit from a given division in the building. This method will return the nearest division to the given one that is an exit. The nearest division is the one with the shortest path.
      Parameters:
      currentDivision - the division to find the nearest exit from
      exits - the exits in the building
      Returns:
      the nearest exit division
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if the exits list is empty

    • getDivision

      public Division getDivision(String name)
      Finds a division in the building by name. This method iterates over all divisions in the building (i.e., all vertices in the graph) and returns the first one with a name that matches the one passed as an argument. The comparison is case-insensitive. If no division with the given name is found, the method returns null.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the division to find
      Returns:
      the division with the given name, or null if not found

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection(Division from, Division to) throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Adds a connection between two divisions in the building. If either of the divisions passed as arguments is null, the method does nothing and returns immediately. Otherwise, the method adds an edge between the two divisions in the graph, and adds the names of the connected divisions to each other's lists of neighbors.
      Parameters:
      from - the first division to connect
      to - the second division to connect
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if either division has no neighbors

    • getNumExitsEntrys

      public int getNumExitsEntrys()
      Returns the number of exit-entry divisions in the building.
      Returns:
      the number of exit-entry divisions as an integer

    • getExitEntryNames

      public Structures.ArrayList<String> getExitEntryNames()
      Returns a list of the names of all the exit-entry divisions in the building.
      Returns:
      a list of strings containing the names of the exit-entry divisions

    • addExitEntry

      public void addExitEntry(Division division) throws Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException
      Adds a division to the list of exit-entry divisions in the building. If the division is already in the list, the method does nothing.
      Parameters:
      division - the division to add
      Throws:
      Exceptions.EmptyCollectionException - if the list of exit-entry divisions is empty

    • setExitsEntrys

      public void setExitsEntrys(Structures.ArrayList<Division> exitsEntrys)
      Sets the list of exit-entry divisions in the building. If the argument is null, the method does nothing and the list of exit-entry divisions remains unchanged.
      Parameters:
      exitsEntrys - the new list of exit-entry divisions

    • getExitsEntrys

      public Structures.ArrayList<Division> getExitsEntrys()
      Returns the list of exit-entry divisions in the building. This method provides access to the current list of divisions that are designated as exits or entries within the building.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the exit-entry divisions

    • printMap

      public void printMap()
      Prints a visual representation of the building's map. This method prints a text-based representation of the building's map, showing the divisions and connections between them.
